<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MISC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/news-recap-oil-prices-gm-strike-purdue-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
News Stories Age Like a Fine Argentinian Malbec
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="News Stories Age Like a Fine Argentinian Malbec" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4NjcwNTY2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The news cycle moves at lightning speed, <span>but some stories stand the test of time. Here are updates on three humdingers of headlines from the past few days.</span></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Oil disruptions</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Energy markets went wild following a weekend drone attack on a major Saudi Aramco facility. Brent crude futures, the global benchmark for oil, rose as much as 19.5% in a record-setting day.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But prices </span><span><span>settled on a 15% gain</span></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-stockpiles-cap-price-surge-after-saudi-attack-11568635889?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">possibly</a></span><span> because traders remembered there's a lot of extra oil sloshing around the world right now.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, gas prices in the U.S. could increase 10–25 cents in the next few weeks, <a href="https://beta.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/09/16/saudi-oil-attacks-could-cause-us-gas-prices-rise-by-cents-gallon-experts-say/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to</a> OANDA analyst Ed Moya. That’s not great timing. A rise could hamper U.S. consumer spending, the economy’s brightest light. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Aramco itself is in damage control</strong>: Execs for the state-owned oil giant are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/attack-increases-risks-for-saudi-aramcos-ipo-11568621756?mod=hp_lead_pos2&mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly</a> debating whether to delay plans to go public until after it gets production back on track—which <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/aramco-said-to-face-weeks-without-majority-of-abqaiq-output?cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business&utm_content=business&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_source=twitter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could take</a> weeks.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">GM workers walk out </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">About 46,000 GM (-4.25%) employees who are members of United Auto Workers (UAW) <a href="https://www.freep.com/story/money/cars/2019/09/15/uaw-strike-gm-autoworker-contract-talks/2333883001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked off</a> the job 11:59pm Sunday night in the union’s first nationwide work stoppage since 2007. The strike <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/16/business/uaw-gm-strike-general-motors/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">impacted</a> 52 facilities in nine states.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With no cars rolling off the lines, GM’s daily earnings losses could hit at least $50 million, per Credit Suisse. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The UAW’s sitting on $850 million in its strike fund and will pay strikers $250/week. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A UAW negotiator told <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/gm-union-far-apart-in-contract-talks-uaw-lead-negotiator-says?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a> they’ve only settled 2% of about 1,000 outstanding proposals with GM, so...don’t hold your breath. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Purdues and don’ts </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/purdue-pharma-seeks-bankruptcy-to-short-circuit-opioid-suits-k0luhox6?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially filed</a> for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in New York as part of its settlement plan to resolve the 2,000+ lawsuits currently filed against the company and its owners, the Sackler family. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/16/us/purdue-pharma-bankruptcy-filing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be</a> passed off to a trust controlled by the many states, cities, counties, and intergalactic colonies currently suing Purdue over its alleged role in the opioid crisis. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/techs-fall-hardware-calendar?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is That a PSL in Your Pocket, or a New Phone?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjQ0L3NjcmVlbl9zaG90XzIwMTlfMDlfMTZfYXRfMTJfMTBfMjlfcG1fMF9wbmcucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fall means three things...pumpkin spice lattes, cringey jokes about pumpkin spice lattes, and new tech hardware. All your favorite tech giants are coming out with new tiny computers to stare at during your commute. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From Axios’s <a href="https://www.axios.com/tech-hardware-releases-fall-holiday-shopping-45be825b-d797-4075-bb11-295a52a36df4.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">useful breakdown</a>… </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Google</strong></span><span> said yesterday it </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/google-pixel4-oct-15-new-york-886ad884-191c-4ae4-8f8f-046dc385e820.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will debut</a></span><span> </span><span><span>"a few new things" (probably hardware)</span></span><span> at an event on Oct. 15 in New York. You might’ve already seen a leaked version of the Pixel 4, but this will </span><span><span>likely </span></span><span>be the official close-up. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple’s</strong></span><span> newest iPhones and Watch hit stores this Friday, but expect more shiny things from Cupertino next month. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Microsoft</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/8/27/20834766/microsoft-surface-event-new-york-city-october-date-dual-screen-rumors?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has</a></span><span> a Surface event planned for Oct. 2. It </span><span><em>might </em></span><span>unveil a new </span><span><span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Harry Potter character</span></span><span> dual-screen device codenamed “Centaurus.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Facebook</strong></span><span> promised additions to its Portal line at Code Conference back in June. One possibility? A </span><span><a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/facebook-portal-tv-1203335443/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TV set-top</a></span><span> version. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Amazon’s</strong></span><span> event is right around the corner. Judging by the past, we’re likely to get new Echo- and Fire-related gizmos next Wednesday. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Axios reminds us that demand for tiny computers has waned over privacy concerns and spending-$1,000-for-a-phone concerns.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIZ LAW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/bigwigs-jpmorgans-precious-metals-desk-charged-manipulating-market?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
JPMorgan Turns Up the Racket
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. prosecutors have charged a group of bigwigs at JPMorgan’s (-0.87%) precious metals desk with “conspiracy to conduct the affairs of an enterprise involved in interstate or foreign commerce through a pattern of racketeering activity.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Running that through Brewgle Translate...</strong>the traders <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2d7be5a6-d87a-11e9-8f9b-77216ebe1f17?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allegedly manipulated prices</a> of metals like gold, silver, platinum, and palladium from 2008–2016 using a technique called “spoofing.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s spoofing?</strong> It’s when traders make buy and sell orders for precious metals futures contracts with zero intention of actually <em>executing</em> the orders...but with every intention of influencing prices in their favor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This spoofing is more serious than its name implies, though. Those charged this week allegedly <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-metals-charges/u-s-charges-jpmorgan-metals-traders-over-alleged-market-manipulation-idUSKBN1W11BF?feedType=RSS&feedName=businessNews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generated millions</a> in trading profits for themselves and Mother Morgan while triggering millions in losses for customers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And prosecutors’ decision to characterize the alleged price fixing as a “criminal” enterprise within JPM puts it under scrutiny typically reserved for organized crime rings. As <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/jpmorgan-s-metals-desk-was-a-criminal-enterprise-u-s-says?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg points out</a>, that could mean JPM—one of the world’s largest gold traders—is at risk of broader legal trouble.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/latest-tour-madonna-wants-less?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Madonna’s Shiny and New Pricing Strategy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Madonna’s Shiny and New Pricing Strategy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/rouH4z2kufyzm/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Madonna’s Shiny and New Pricing Strategy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/rouH4z2kufyzm/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Madonna—Queen of Pop and Protector of On-Stage PDA—kicks off her 11th tour, “Madame X.” And the ticket price changes this time around are...material.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Madonna’s new strategy:</strong> play smaller venues and charge more for tickets, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/madonnas-new-concert-ticket-strategy-higher-prices-smaller-venues-11568644941?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the WSJ reports</a>. But that’s the kind of market power you earn when you hold the record for highest-grossing concert tour for a woman.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Madame X tickets average about $300, up from about $160 for Madonna’s last tour.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The uptick is due primarily to a price hike for upper-tier tickets. The priciest non-VIP Madonna tickets go for about $750 this time around before fees, compared to $350 </span><span><span>during</span></span><span> her last three tours.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The digitization of music has put pressure on margins. If you’re Madonna, you try smaller venues and lengthier trips in certain cities. If you’re Taylor Swift or Jay-Z, you raise prices. If you’re Ed Sheeran, you just play...<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/20/ed-sheeran-love-shape?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more</a>.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F16%2Flatest-tour-madonna-wants-less" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+ticket+price+changes+this+time+around+are...material.&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/latest-tour-madonna-wants-less&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/16/venture-trigo-trying-away-checkout-lines?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Checkout Lines May Trigo the Way of the Dodo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Welcome to Venture This, where we toss out a startup generating buzz...then ask: would you invest?</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The only thing worse than forgetting your parka before heading to the ice cream aisle is watching your ice cream melt while you wait in the checkout line.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why Israeli tech startup <strong style="color:#000">Trigo</strong> is trying to jumpstart cashierless grocery store tech. And it just <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/israel-s-trigo-raises-22-million-to-expand-cashierless-stores?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $22 million</a> to bring that tech to the U.S. and Europe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trigo’s plan:</strong> provide grocers with cameras, 3D computer vision, and cloud computing <a href="https://venturebeat.com/2019/09/16/trigo-raises-22-million-to-challenge-amazon-go-with-automated-grocery-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to track</a> what customers take from shelves. It’s already inked a deal with Tesco, the U.K.’s largest grocery chain.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One downside? Trigo’s </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/16/trigo-raises-22m-for-an-automated-grocery-check-out-platform-similar-to-amazon-go/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">piloting</a></span><span> in stores ≤ 5,000 sq. ft. For context, the average Trader Joe’s is closer to 20,000 sq. ft. and the average Trader Joe’s checkout line can reach 40,000 ft. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big picture:</strong> Call this the Amazon Go effect, seeing as Bezos may open up to 3,000 checkout-free stores in the U.S. alone. Other chains are increasingly looking to automation to <span>employ fewer people and trim costs</span>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, we open the floor to you, Brewemmer Venture Partners. Would you invest in Trigo’s next round? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/N0kxYc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Let us know here</a>.</p>

Here are updates on three humdingers of headlines from the past few days.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOil disruptions\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnergy markets went wild following a weekend drone attack on a major Saudi Aramco facility. Brent crude futures, the global benchmark for oil, rose as much as 19.5% in a record-setting day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut prices \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003esettled on a 15% gain\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-stockpiles-cap-price-surge-after-saudi-attack-11568635889?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epossibly\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e because traders remembered there's a lot of extra oil sloshing around the world right now.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, gas prices in the U.S. could increase 10–25 cents in the next few weeks, \u003ca href=\"https://beta.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/09/16/saudi-oil-attacks-could-cause-us-gas-prices-rise-by-cents-gallon-experts-say/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to\u003c/a\u003e OANDA analyst Ed Moya. That’s not great timing. A rise could hamper U.S. consumer spending, the economy’s brightest light. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAramco itself is in damage control\u003c/strong\u003e: Execs for the state-owned oil giant are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/attack-increases-risks-for-saudi-aramcos-ipo-11568621756?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereportedly\u003c/a\u003e debating whether to delay plans to go public until after it gets production back on track—which \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/aramco-said-to-face-weeks-without-majority-of-abqaiq-output?cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business\u0026utm_content=business\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould take\u003c/a\u003e weeks.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGM workers walk out \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAbout 46,000 GM (-4.25%) employees who are members of United Auto Workers (UAW) \u003ca href=\"https://www.freep.com/story/money/cars/2019/09/15/uaw-strike-gm-autoworker-contract-talks/2333883001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalked off\u003c/a\u003e the job 11:59pm Sunday night in the union’s first nationwide work stoppage since 2007. The strike \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/16/business/uaw-gm-strike-general-motors/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimpacted\u003c/a\u003e 52 facilities in nine states.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith no cars rolling off the lines, GM’s daily earnings losses could hit at least $50 million, per Credit Suisse. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe UAW’s sitting on $850 million in its strike fund and will pay strikers $250/week. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA UAW negotiator told \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/gm-union-far-apart-in-contract-talks-uaw-lead-negotiator-says?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg\u003c/a\u003e they’ve only settled 2% of about 1,000 outstanding proposals with GM, so...don’t hold your breath. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePurdues and don’ts \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/purdue-pharma-seeks-bankruptcy-to-short-circuit-opioid-suits-k0luhox6?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficially filed\u003c/a\u003e for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in New York as part of its settlement plan to resolve the 2,000+ lawsuits currently filed against the company and its owners, the Sackler family. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/16/us/purdue-pharma-bankruptcy-filing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be\u003c/a\u003e passed off to a trust controlled by the many style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunning that through Brewgle Translate...\u003c/strong\u003ethe traders \u003ca smaller venues and charge more for tickets, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/madonnas-new-concert-ticket-strategy-higher-prices-smaller-venues-11568644941?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe WSJ reports\u003c/a\u003e. But that’s the kind of market power you earn when you hold the record for highest-grossing concert tour for a woman.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMadame X tickets average about $300, up from about $160 for Madonna’s last tour.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe uptick is due primarily to a price hike for upper-tier tickets. The priciest non-VIP Madonna tickets go for about $750 this time around before fees, compared to $350 \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eduring\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e her last three tours.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe digitization of music has put pressure on margins. If you’re Madonna, you try smaller venues and lengthier trips in certain cities. If you’re Taylor Swift or Jay-Z, you raise prices. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWelcome to Venture This, where we toss out a startup generating buzz...then ask: would you invest?\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe only thing worse than forgetting your parka before heading to the ice cream aisle is watching your ice cream melt while you wait in the checkout line.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s why Israeli tech startup \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrigo\u003c/strong\u003e is trying to jumpstart cashierless grocery store tech. And it just \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-16/israel-s-trigo-raises-22-million-to-expand-cashierless-stores?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised $22 million\u003c/a\u003e to bring that tech to the U.S. and Europe.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrigo’s plan:\u003c/strong\u003e provide grocers with cameras, 3D computer vision, and cloud computing \u003ca href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2019/09/16/trigo-raises-22-million-to-challenge-amazon-go-with-automated-grocery-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto track\u003c/a\u003e what customers take from shelves. It’s already inked a deal with Tesco, the U.K.’s largest grocery chain.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne downside? Trigo’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/16/trigo-raises-22m-for-an-automated-grocery-check-out-platform-similar-to-amazon-go/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epiloting\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in stores ≤ 5,000 sq. ft. For context, the average Trader Joe’s is closer to 20,000 sq. ft. and the average Trader Joe’s checkout line can reach 40,000 ft. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Call this the Amazon Go effect, seeing as Bezos may open up to 3,000 checkout-free stores in the U.S. alone. Other chains are increasingly looking to automation to \u003cspan\u003eemploy fewer people and trim costs\u003c/span\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, we open the floor to you, Brewemmer Venture Partners.
